values.help: Parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. Options for changing parameter 1-98. Default 1.
values.label: Minimum brightness level

values.help: Parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. Options for changing parameter 2-99. Default 99.
values.label: Maximum brightness level

values.help: Virtual value set as a percentage level between parameters MIN (1%) and MAX. (99%). The Dimmer will set to this value after first switch on. It is required for warming up and switching dimmable compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Options for changing parameter 1-99. Default 1.
values.label: Incandescence level of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps

values.help: This parameter determines the time required for switching compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Setting this parameter to 0 will disable the incandescence functionality. Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 25,5s)
values.label: Incandescence time of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps

values.help: Available settings: 1-99 Default: 1
values.label: The percentage of a dimming step at automatic control

values.help: Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s) Default setting: 1
values.label: Time of a dimming step at automatic control

values.help: Available settings: 1-99 Default: 1
values.label: The percentage of a dimming step at manual control

values.help: Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s) Default setting: 1
values.label: Time of a dimming step at manual control

values.help: Saving state before power failure. Default 1.
values.label: Saving state before power failure

items.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

values.help: Available settings: 0 - Function disabled; 1-32767 - time to turn off measured in seconds (1s - 9,1h) Default setting: 0
values.label: Timer functionality (auto - off)

values.help: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF. Default 255.
values.label: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF

items.label: ALL ON active / ALL OFF active
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF active
ALL ON active / ALL OFF disabled

values.help: Changing value of this parameter will force the calibration process.
values.label: Force auto-calibration

items.label: idle
Start auto-calibration of the load without Fibaro Bypass
Start auto-calibration of the load with Fibaro Bypass

values.help: This parameter determines operating mode of the Dimmer (automatic/manual settings).
values.label: Auto-calibration status

items.label: calibration procedure not performed or Dimmer operates on manual settings
Dimmer operates on auto-calibration settings

values.help: Function based on the sudden power variation of a specific value, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR. Available settings: 0 - function disabled; 1-99 - percentage value of power variation, compared to standard power consumption, measured during the calibration procedure (to be interpreted as load error/burnt out bulb) Default setting: 30
values.label: Burnt out bulb detection

values.help: Time of delay (in seconds) for power variation detection, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR or OVERLOAD detection (too much power connected to the Dimmer). Available settings: 0 - detection of a burnt out bulb disabled; 1-255 - delay time in seconds; Default setting: 5
values.label: Time delay of a burnt out bulb

values.help: If the parameter is active, switching on the Dimmer (S1 single click) will always set this brightness level. Available settings: 0 - function disabled; 1-99 - percentage level of brightness; Default setting: 0
values.label: Forced switch on brightness level

values.help: Binary inputs type configuration. Default 0.
values.label: Inputs Button/Switch configuration

items.label: Mono-stable input (button)
Bi-stable input (switch)
Role blind switch (UP / DOWN) - two switch keys operate the Dimmer

values.help: The value sent to associated devices on single click.
values.label: The value sent to associated devices on single click

items.label: 0xFF value is sent, which will set associated devices to their last saved state.
Current Dimmer state is sent, which will synchronize brightness level of associated devices (other Dimmers for example).

values.label: Assign toggle switch status to the device status

items.label: Device changes status on switch status change
Device status is synchronized with switch status

values.help: Double-click set lighting at 100%. Default 1.
values.label: Double click option

items.label: Disable double click
Enable double click

values.label: Command frames sent in 2-nd and 3-rd association groups (S1 associations)
Command frames sent in 4-th and 5-th association groups (S2 associations)

values.help: Switch no. 2 controls the Dimmer additionally (in 3-way switch mode). Function disabled for parameter 20 set to 2 (roller blind switch)
values.label: The function of 3-way switch

items.label: 3-way switch function for S2 disabled
3-way switch function for S2 enabled

values.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode

values.help: SCENE ID depends on the switch type configurations. Default 0.
values.label: Scene activation functionality

items.label: Functionality deactivated
Functionality activated

values.label: Switch functionality of S1 and S2

items.label: standard mode
S1 operates as S2, S2 operates as S1

values.help: Forced auto-calibration will set this parameter value to 2.
values.label: Load control mode

items.label: forced leading edge control
forced trailing edge control
control mode selected automatically (based on auto-calibration)

values.help: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration.
values.label: Load control mode

items.label: leading edge
trailing edge

values.help: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration.
values.label: On/Off mode

items.label: on/off mode disabled (dimming is possible)
on/off mode enabled (dimming is not possible)
mode selected automatically

values.help: Dimmability of the load
values.label: Dimmability of the load

items.label: Load recognized as dimmable
Load recognized as non-dimmable

values.help: Time required to warm up the filament of halogen bulb.
values.label: Soft-Start functionality

items.label: no soft-start
short soft-start (0.1s)
long soft-start (0.5s)

values.help: This parameter determines the trigger of auto-calibration procedure, e.g. power on, load error, etc.
values.label: Auto-calibration after power on

items.label: No auto-calibration of the load after power on
Auto-calibration performed after first power on
Auto-calibration performed after each power on
Auto-calibration performed after first power on or after each LOAD ERROR alarm (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb)
Auto-calibration performed after each power on or after each LOAD ERROR alarm (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb),

values.help: Behaviour of the Dimmer after OVERCURRENT or SURGE
values.label: Behaviour of the Dimmer after OVERCURRENT or SURGE

items.label: device permanently disabled until re-enabling by comand or external switch
three atempts to turn on the load

values.help: Correction reduces spontaneous flickering of some capacitive load (e.g. dimmable lEDs) at certain brightness levels in 2-wire installation. In countries using ripple-control, correction may cause changes in brightness. In this case it is necessary to disable correction or adjust time of correction for flickering loads. Available settings: 0 - automatic correction disabled 1-254 - duration of correction in seconds 255 - automatic correction always enabled Default setting: 255
values.label: Brightness level correction for flickering loads

values.help: Reaching the defined value will result in turning off the load. Additional apparent power limit of 350VA is active by default. Available settings: 0 - functionality disabled; 1-350 - 1W-350W; Default setting: 250
values.label: Power limit - OVERLOAD

values.help: Response to General Purpose Alarm; Default 3.
values.label: Response to General Purpose Alarm

items.label: No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

values.help: Response to Water Flooding Alarm; Default 2.
values.label: Response to Water Flooding Alarm

items.label: No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

values.help: Response to Smoke, CO or CO2 Alarm; Default 3.
values.label: Response to Smoke, CO or CO2 Alarm

items.label: No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

values.help: Response to Temperature Alarm; Default 1.
values.label: Response to Temperature Alarm

items.label: No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

values.help: Alarm state may be cancelled earlier, as a result of pressing the switches or sending the Z-Wave command frame.
values.label: Time of alarm state

values.help: OVERLOAD alarm report (load power consumption too high)
values.label: OVERLOAD alarm report

items.label: No reaction
Send an alarm frame

values.help: LOAD ERROR alarm report (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb)
values.label: LOAD ERROR alarm report

items.label: No reaction
Send an alarm frame

values.help: OVERCURRENT alarm report (short circuit, burnt out bulb causing overcurrent)
values.label: OVERCURRENT alarm report

items.label: No reaction
Send an alarm frame

values.help: SURGE alarm report (Dimmer output overvoltage)
values.label: SURGE alarm report

items.label: No reaction
Send an alarm frame

values.help: OVERHEAT (critical temperature) and VOLTAGE DROP (low voltage) alarm report
values.label: OVERHEAT and VOLTAGE DROP alarm report

items.label: No reaction
Send an alarm frame

values.label: Active power reports
Periodic active power and energy reports
Energy reports

values.help: The Dimmer may include active power and energy consumed by itself in reports sent to the main controller.
values.label: Self-measurement

items.label: Self-measurement inactive
Self-measurement active

values.help: This parameter defines how to calculate active power. This parameter is useful in a case of 2-wire connection with light sources other than resistive. The parameter is set to 0 after forced auto-calibration.
values.label: Method of calculating the active power

items.label: power measurement based on the standard algorithm
approximation based on the calibration data
approximation based on the control angle

values.help: This parameter determines the approximate value of the power that will be reported by the device at its maximum brightness level. This parameter works only when parameter 58 has a value other than 0. Available settings: 0-500 (0-500W) - power consumed by the load at the maximum brightness level. Default setting: 0
values.label: Approximated power at the maximum brightness level
